ncrsDetermination.abcd:FullScientificNameString: Monzonietporfier met antleriet, chalkanthiet en kupriet
ncrsDetermination.abcd:InformalNameString: Typical banded quarz-sulphide vein in monzonite porphyry. (Strike is NeSSE) Antlerite, chalcanthite and cuprite are beginning to develop
Typical disseminated ore minus characteristic veinlets of sulphide. tenor dependsw upon spacing of disseminated grains. 1% Cu
Granite ore showing veinlets of turquois derived by weathering from apatite in adjacent basic dikes
